lead_paragraph: A judge said Leonard Strickland was subjected to excessive force and faulty medical care at the Clinton Correctional Facility, but there was no evidence that a beating directly caused his death.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

headline.print_headline: State Prison Guards Were ‘Negligent’ in Fatal Encounter With Inmate, Judge Rules
headline.main: Guards Were ‘Negligent’ in Fatal Encounter With New York Inmate, Judge Rules

snippet: A judge said Leonard Strickland was subjected to excessive force and faulty medical care at the Clinton Correctional Facility, but there was no evidence that a beating directly caused his death....
abstract: New York State Court of Claims Judge Frank P Milano rules that while officers at Clinton Correctional Facility used excessive force on inmate Leonard Strickland during confrontation in 2010, there is no evidence that beating or subsequent inadequate medical care directly caused Strickland's death.
